blocks.text: In these final three sessions we are going to lean into the third core value of “BELONG” and how our love for God and neighbors is lived out together in a welcoming spiritual family.
Our mission at Neighborhood Church is to love God and our neighbors together. That “together” is the beautiful way God designed His people to grow, serve, and multiply.

items: Loving God → We desire to BE God’s satisfied children, love Him, and glorify Him.
And our neighbors → We desire to BLESS others where we live, work, and play.
Together → We BELONG to a welcoming spiritual family.

blocks.text: As we grow in our relationship with the Father, we are built into a spiritual family that holds one another up, encourages one another, and multiplies together. This is the orchard - roots deep in Christ, branches reaching out to bless, and fruit that multiplies for the Kingdom.

blocks.text: Summary Teaching

Jesus didn’t just call us to make disciples - He called us to make disciples who make disciples. The Great Commission is not a suggestion; it is the joyful overflow of a life that belongs to Him. When we abide in the Vine, we naturally bear fruit that multiplies.

Paul told Timothy to entrust what he had learned to faithful men who would be able to teach others also. This is multiplication - one life investing in another, who invests in another, until the whole orchard is full of fruit.

At Neighborhood Church we multiply when every leader helps the people in their home and neighborhood belong to Jesus and then belong to His family. The spiritual family grows when we live on mission together.
